title: Principles of Healthcare Delivery
headline: Learn how to respect the dignity and legal rights of patients to provide optimal healthcare in this free online course.
description: Healthcare professionals must abide by certain legal principles governing patient care and their relationships with the public. Doctors require more than a firm grasp on medicine and this course discusses concepts like equality, diversity and inclusion (DEI). We examine the UK legislation designed to protect the rights and wellbeing of patients. We also go through the Caldicott principles governing privacy and risk management in care facilities.

courseDescription:
Providing excellent healthcare requires medical skills that include a proper understanding of equality, diversity and inclusion. This course is designed by Alpha Academy to help medical personnel and caregivers of any skill level. All care workers must be able to identify incidents involving discrimination and promote the principles of equality and diversity as they perform their roles. We will examine the UK’s legislation and policies established to support these principles and ensure the dignity of those in your care.

The course then explores the person-centred approach applied to planning for individual and social care settings. It is typically an effective way to place the service user at the centre of care planning stages and empower them to significantly influence the care and support they receive. We explain how to support the lifestyle of care receivers and review the different activities that promote their wellbeing.

We then show you how to preserve the mental health and self-esteem of clients, which is an essential element of a caregiver’s role. Finally, our last lesson explains how to deal with complex and sensitive situations and manage risk. This social work and healthcare course helps you to develop empathy, sensitivity and a good sense of fairness in your dealings with clients and patients. Sign up to learn how to respect DEI values and protect the dignity and wellbeing of those in your care.
